paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with varying degrees of neuropathy and cardiac involvement.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Distal weakness, sensory loss, gastrointestinal upset, and cardiac symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic test for ATTRv found a Phe64Leu (p.Phe84Leu) mutation of the TTR gene.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Distal sensory loss, family history of severe polyneuropathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A genetic testing showed a Phe64Leu (p.Phe84Leu) mutation in the TTR gene.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic carrier with a known family history of ATTRv.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient already knew to be a carrier of a Glu89Gln (p.Glu109Gln) mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Phe64Leu mutation is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to misfolded TTR protein aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: The Phe64Leu mutation segregates with disease in families, as seen in the affected siblings.
variants.additional_notes: The Glu89Gln mutation was also mentioned but is not the focus of this extraction.
key_quotes: Genetic test for ATTRv found a Phe64Leu (p.Phe84Leu) mutation of the TTR gene.
A genetic testing showed a Phe64Leu (p.Phe84Leu) mutation in the TTR gene.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with gastrointestinal and neurological symptoms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diarrhea, weight loss, and neurological symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing, performed in July 2019, confirmed the presence of Glu89Gln (p.Glu109Gln) mutation on the TTR gene.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic carrier with a known family history of ATTRv.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient already knew to be a carrier of a Glu89Gln (p.Glu109Gln) mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Glu89Gln mutation is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to misfolded TTR protein aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: The Glu89Gln mutation segregates with disease in families, as seen in the affected sibling.
variants.additional_notes: The Phe64Leu mutation was also mentioned but is not the focus of this extraction.
key_quotes: Genetic testing, performed in July 2019, confirmed the presence of Glu89Gln (p.Glu109Gln) mutation on the TTR gene.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
